events.name: An Afternoon with Marc Jones, CTO, SoftLayer
events.description: Forget Kick-starting your startup. It’s all about Zooming Ahead! Throw out those Servers, Bring in the Cloud! - Marc Jones, Chief Technology Officer, SoftLayer One of the biggest challenges for startups, no matter how brilliant the idea or, how innovative the app, is dealing with the technical side of business. Not only are you expected to get that out-of-the-box idea, plan for it, seek investors for it but you also have to seek the right technical infrastructure to take it to the masses. Well, who says you have to be technical to get that business off the ground. With everything on the cloud all you need to know about IT systems is click, point, order - and hey presto, your systems are up and running in minutes and hours, not days and months! It’s a Cloud fest - Spend time with Marc Jones as he takes us through what are the latest products in the market and what other startups are doing with the technology. Agenda: 1400 to 1415: Pre-networking 1415 to 1430: Talk by Marc Jones 1430 to 1600: Discussion + Q&A + Networking (Casual) Registration: Plugin @ NUS Enterprise Marc Jones Chief Technology Officer, SoftLayer, an IBM Company Marc Jones leads SoftLayer’s technology design and architecture teams, which focus on the development of new products and services and research and development in SoftLayer Labs. Prior to joining SoftLayer, Jones served as director of software product development for Rackspace’s cloud division.

events.name: Interactive Community Security & Data Panel Q&A!
events.description: Edit: PANELISTS: - Eric Meyer (CEO and founder @ Apvera : Adaptive Security Analytics Company) - Dr. NG Wee Keong (Associate Chair @ NTU School of Computer Engineering) Dr.Ng works in privacy-preserving data analytics, encrypted data storage for cloud computing, data mining, and database systems. His publications have appeared in the ACM Transactions on Knowledge Discovery from Data, IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering, ACM Computing Surveys, Data and Knowledge Engineering Journal, and other major journals. - Gary Lim (Chief Security Advisor @ Microsoft) -Stephen Cavey (Cofounder @ Groundlabs : Data Breach Prevention Software for Security Compliance) TOPICS / TALKING POINTS Innovation in Singapore • Cyber Security on enterprises applications, Wearables and IoT. WORKPLACE CHALLENGES • Data Privacy • Using IoT in the workplace • Zero Day • Behavioral Sciences • Machine learning and AI FUTURE OUTLOOK • How the future will be shaped MESSAGE: Hi folks, I am going to kickoff this group with an Event to involve the community, and a panel discussion is the front runner. More information to be confirmed along the way. So far I do have 2 sponsors for this event, our friends at Microsoft and Apvera. And a few panelist from those respected companies as well, If anyone would like to participate as a panelist please reach out to me. Hope to see everyone there! Free shirts and food by the way so snack and meet new people! Thanks! Paul
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome!

events.name: Pivotal open source night
events.description: At this meetup we will host two technical talks about software engineering and best practices. One talk will be by - Sergiu Bodiu , a Sr. Solution Architect on the Pivotal team, about building cloud native applications. The other talk will be by Kailash Nath one of our best Hadoop expert at Pivotal Asia. Find details about both talks below: 6:45 - 7:15 :: Food and networking 7:15 - 8:45 :: Talks and Q&A 8:45 - 9:00 :: Mingling -------------- Talk Title: Build Cloud Native applications Speaker: Sergiu Bodiu, Sr. Solution Architect, Pivotal Abstract: There’s a certain “dark ages” between the waning days of Java and .Net and the renaissance we have now with PaaS and other microservices-think driven platforms. "GoldPlating" That's right, friend. Before long, you'll discover that almost any problem can be made more complicated! Tap into the unemptyable wells of PrematureComplexity & AccidentalComplexity, and have a heyday! Fortunately many of the innovators in the space, including Twitter, LinkedIn, and Netflix, have embraced the JVM as they’ve built increasingly complex systems. Spring Cloud provides tools for developers to quickly build some of the common patterns in distributed systems. Spring Boot is a micro framework for micro service applications. With the advent of microservice and cloud-native application architectures, building distributed systems is becoming increasingly common for the enterprise Java developer. About: Sergiu is a seasoned consultant experienced in large-scale e-commerce projects, passionate about providing innovative technology solutions to solve complex business problems, have extensive knowledge and experience delivering enterprise wide applications. ===================== Talk Title: "Implementing Hadoop in a large enterprise - experience sharing" Speaker: Kailash Nath, Technical Architect, Pivotal (we have interviewed Kailash here ). "Yay! I see the elephant in the room". It took a real long time for those "strategists" to accept the fact that there is an elephant in the room. How many of them really see the full elephant? Business intelligence has been used by architects for assessing architecture model and correct EA strategy all along. And so pattern like distributed computing is nothing new for them. Yet, why Hadoop/big data initiative fail or don't impress while nextgen Silicon valley enterprises make software that is eating the world using these tools? Data analytics use cases are often IT teams view of business rather than business use case defined by business users. If you don't have a big data business use case sponsored by business user, stop your project right now and save money/energy of those highly paid Hadoop experts. About: Kailash is a Technical architect with 14+ years of industry experience. Prior to joining Pivotal, he has lead the big data initiative for a large airline company and has worked 3 years on some of the largest Hadoop projects. His experience includes end to end architecture and design of large scale OLTP system like B2B e-Commerce platform, large scale integrations solutions, mobile commerce platform, high volume OLAP solutions etc.
events.location: PayPal office in Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue Millenia Tower #14-01, Singapore

events.name: Xamarin Forms and Azure Storage - Azure & SGDotNET User Groups @ 9-April 7:00pm
events.description: Invitation for User Group meeting (9th April) and Azure Bootcamp on (25th April) The UG leads of both Azure and SGdotNet have gotten together and organizing the events together. For a start, we’re organizing UG events with speakers from both sides of the technology! Date: 9th APR 2015 Venue: Level 21, Auditorium , Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Time: Generally starts at 7pm sharp . Topic 1: X-Mobile dev awesomeness with Xamarin Forms + TestUI + Specflow + Fun By Ben Levy We'll learn how to do some awesome cross platform mobile development (android/ios) the bdd way with xamarin forms, specflow and testui. We'll end up producing clean side effect free code with end to end test for our backend and frontend (the same scenario runs on both. Magic!) To learn about more speaker visit http://www.meetup.com/SingaporeMobileDev/events/221236509/ Topic 2: Cloud (Azure) Storage By Murali Krishnan Global Azure Boot Camp—Singapore Chapter A Windows Azure Boot Camp On More Than 100 Location Globally at The Same Time This one day deep dive class will get you up to speed on developing for Microsoft Azure. The class includes trainers with deep real world experience with Microsoft Azure. Register or more details at http://singapore.azurebootcamp.net - 3 Tracks (Developer / IT Pro/Data and Special track - 15 Speakers and - 15 Sessions. - Free entry and Lots of free girts (Including Surface 3 Pro)
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: X-Mobile dev awesomeness with Xamarin Forms + TestUI + Specflow + Fun
events.description: Program: X-Mobile dev awesomeness with Xamarin Forms + TestUI + Specflow + Fun By Ben Ishiyama-Levy: We'll learn how to do some awesome cross platform mobile development (android/ios) the bdd way with xamarin forms, specflow and testui. We'll end up producing clean side effect free code with end to end test for our backend and frontend (the same scenario runs on both. magic!) 10 hours of Xamarin TestCloud to be won by a happy winner Also, you are welcome to ask me for advice on mobile projects you are working on Cloud (Azure) Storage By Murali Krishnan Global Azure Boot Camp—Singapore Chapter A Windows Azure Boot Camp On More Than 100 Location Globally at The Same Time This one day deep dive class will get you up to speed on developing for Microsoft Azure. The class includes trainers with deep real world experience with Microsoft Azure. Wrap-up includes socializing, nonsense, and maybe a drink with awesome folks!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm Metamorphosis By Panagiotis Tomaras and Tom Shellsuit 7.45pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Enjoy a feast for the eyes and the ears through visual artist Panagiotis Tomaras' stunning video work complemented with sounds by DJ Tom Shellsuit. Presenting an interplay between sight and sound, initial slow, transformative imagery is replaced with rapid, geometric movement, and ends with a vivid treatment of colour inspired by the flicker films of the early 60's. This April, ArtScience Late presents digital art at its best, with music to match. ArtScience Late celebrates Global IoT Day, 9th April 2015 with this digital showcase of art and technology. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis.
